title: [Tony Agapitos Home Movie Collection: Reel 8]
other_title: Tony Agapitos Home Movies: Fundraiser BBQ and dance
subject_group: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Immigrants - Australia
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Greeks - Australia
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Home movies and video
abstract: From a collection of 16mm film of migrant life in Victoria in the 1950s to the 1970s, by Tony Agapitos. This works shows a small fundraiser and social occasion with Greek youth holding a raffle, barbeque and dance. Money raised supported the Miss Greek Charity pageant. (circa 1965)
description: Tony Agapitos was a Greek immigrant and film-maker who documented aspects of life in the Greek community in Melbourne during the 1950s to the 1970s. He focused on significant political, social and religious events, including the arrival of Greek ships at Victoria docks, celebrations and dances, protest marches, political meetings and religious occasions. ACMI holds all of the known footage shot by Agapitos. The material comprises approximately three hours of footage and was shot on 16mm and 35mm film.  This short film shows a small fundraiser and social occassion with the local Greek youth by holding a raffle, barbeque and dance. The reason for the occassion was to gather funds to support the Miss Greek Charity Quest.
